text: The words of Nehemiah son of Hacaliah. In the month of Chislev, in the twentieth year, while I was in the citadel of Susa,
speaker: Narrator

text: one of my brothers, Hanani, came with certain men from Judah, and I asked them about the Jews who escaped, those who had survived the captivity, and about Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: They replied, “The remnant there in the province who escaped captivity are in great trouble and shame; the wall of Jerusalem is broken down, and its gates have been destroyed by fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When I heard these words, I sat down and wept and mourned for days, fasting and praying before the God of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, “O Lord God of heaven, the great and awesome God who keeps covenant and steadfast love with those who love him and keep his commandments,
speaker: Narrator

text: let your ear be attentive and your eyes open to hear the prayer of your servant that I now pray before you day and night for your servants, the Israelites, confessing the sins of the Israelites, which we have sinned against you. Both I and my family have sinned.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have offended you deeply, failing to keep the commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances that you commanded Moses your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the word that you commanded Moses your servant, ‘If you are unfaithful, I will scatter you among the peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text: but if you return to me and keep my commandments and do them, though your outcasts are under the farthest skies, I will gather them from there and bring them to the place where I have chosen to establish my name.’
speaker: Narrator

text: They are your servants and your people whom you redeemed by your great power and your strong hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, let your ear be attentive to the prayer of your servant and to the prayer of your servants who delight in revering your name. Give success to your servant today, and grant him mercy in the sight of this man!”
At the time, I was cupbearer to the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the month of Nisan, in the twentieth year of King Artaxerxes, when wine was served him, I carried the wine and gave it to the king. Now, I had never been sad in his presence before.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the king said to me, “Why is your face sad, since you are not sick? This can only be sadness of the heart.” Then I was very much afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said to the king, “May the king live forever! Why should my face not be sad, when the city, the place of my ancestors’ graves, lies waste and its gates have been destroyed by fire?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king said to me, “What do you request?” So I prayed to the God of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said to the king, “If it pleases the king, and if your servant has found favor with you, I ask that you send me to Judah, to the city of my ancestors’ graves, so that I may rebuild it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The king said to me (the queen also was sitting beside him), “How long will you be gone, and when will you return?” So it pleased the king to send me, and I set him a date.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said to the king, “If it pleases the king, let letters be given me to the governors of the province Beyond the River, that they may grant me passage until I arrive in Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a letter to Asaph, the keeper of the king’s forest, directing him to give me timber to make beams for the gates of the temple fortress and for the wall of the city and for the house that I shall occupy.” And the king granted me what I asked, for the gracious hand of my God was upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I came to the governors of the province Beyond the River and gave them the king’s letters. Now the king had sent officers of the army and cavalry with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the Ammonite official heard this, it displeased them greatly that someone had come to seek the welfare of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I came to Jerusalem and was there for three days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I got up during the night, I and a few men with me; I told no one what my God had put into my heart to do for Jerusalem. The only animal I took was the animal I rode.
speaker: Narrator

text: I went out by night by the Valley Gate past the Dragon’s Spring and to the Dung Gate, and I inspected the walls of Jerusalem that had been broken down and its gates that had been destroyed by fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I went on to the Fountain Gate and to the King’s Pool, but there was no place for the animal I was riding to continue.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I went up by way of the valley by night and inspected the wall. Then I turned back and entered by the Valley Gate and so returned.
speaker: Narrator

text: The officials did not know where I had gone or what I was doing; I had not yet told the Jews, the priests, the nobles, the officials, and the rest who were to do the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said to them, “You see the trouble we are in, how Jerusalem lies in ruins with its gates burned. Come, let us rebuild the wall of Jerusalem, so that we may no longer suffer disgrace.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I told them that the hand of my God had been gracious upon me and also the words that the king had spoken to me. Then they said, “Let us start building!” So they committed themselves to the common good.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the Ammonite official and Geshem the Arab heard of it, they mocked and ridiculed us, saying, “What is this that you are doing? Are you rebelling against the king?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I replied to them, “The God of heaven is the one who will give us success, and we his servants are going to start building, but you have no share or claim or memorial in Jerusalem.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the high priest Eliashib set to work with his fellow priests and rebuilt the Sheep Gate. They consecrated it and set up its doors; they consecrated it as far as the Tower of the Hundred and as far as the Tower of Hananel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Jericho built next to him. And next to them Zaccur son of Imri built.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hassenaah built the Fish Gate; they laid its beams and set up its doors, its bolts, and its bars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to them Meremoth son of Uriah son of Hakkoz made repairs. Next to them Meshullam son of Berechiah son of Meshezabel made repairs. Next to them Zadok son of Baana made repairs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to them the Tekoites made repairs, but their nobles would not put their shoulders to the work of their Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joiada son of Paseah and Meshullam son of Besodeiah repaired the Old Gate; they laid its beams and set up its doors, its bolts, and its bars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to them repairs were made by Melatiah the Gibeonite and Jadon the Meronothite—the men of Gibeon and of Mizpah—who were under the jurisdiction of the governor of the province Beyond the River.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to them Uzziel son of Harhaiah, one of the goldsmiths, made repairs. Next to him Hananiah, one of the perfumers, made repairs, and they restored Jerusalem as far as the Broad Wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to them Rephaiah son of Hur, ruler of half the district of Jerusalem, made repairs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to them Jedaiah son of Harumaph made repairs opposite his house, and next to him Hattush son of Hashabneiah made repairs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Malchijah son of Harim and Hasshub son of Pahath-moab repaired another section and the Tower of the Ovens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to him Shallum son of Hallohesh, ruler of half the district of Jerusalem, made repairs, he and his daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hanun and the inhabitants of Zanoah repaired the Valley Gate; they rebuilt it and set up its doors, its bolts, and its bars and repaired a thousand cubits of the wall, as far as the Dung Gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Malchijah son of Rechab, ruler of the district of Beth-haccherem, repaired the Dung Gate; he rebuilt it and set up its doors, its bolts, and its bars.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shallum son of Col-hozeh, ruler of the district of Mizpah, repaired the Fountain Gate; he rebuilt it and covered it and set up its doors, its bolts, and its bars, and he built the wall of the Pool of Shelah of the King’s Garden, as far as the stairs that go down from the city of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him Nehemiah son of Azbuk, ruler of half the district of Beth-zur, repaired from a point opposite the graves of David, as far as the artificial pool and the House of the Warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him the Levites made repairs: Rehum son of Bani; next to him Hashabiah, ruler of half the district of Keilah, made repairs for his district.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him their kin made repairs: Binnui, son of Henadad, ruler of half the district of Keilah;
speaker: Narrator

text: next to him Ezer son of Jeshua, ruler of Mizpah, repaired another section opposite the ascent to the armory at the Angle.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him Baruch son of Zabbai repaired another section from the Angle to the door of the house of the high priest Eliashib.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him Meremoth son of Uriah son of Hakkoz repaired another section from the door of the house of Eliashib to the end of the house of Eliashib.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him the priests, the men of the surrounding area, made repairs.
speaker: Narrator

text: After them Benjamin and Hasshub made repairs opposite their house. After them Azariah son of Maaseiah son of Ananiah made repairs beside his own house.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him Binnui son of Henadad repaired another section, from the house of Azariah to the Angle and to the corner.
speaker: Narrator

text: Palal son of Uzai repaired opposite the Angle and the tower projecting from the upper house of the king at the court of the guard. After him Pedaiah son of Parosh
speaker: Narrator

text: and the temple servants living on Ophel made repairs up to a point opposite the Water Gate on the east and the projecting tower.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him the Tekoites repaired another section opposite the great projecting tower as far as the wall of Ophel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above the Horse Gate the priests made repairs, each one opposite his own house.
speaker: Narrator

text: After them Zadok son of Immer made repairs opposite his own house. After him Shemaiah son of Shecaniah, the keeper of the East Gate, made repairs.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him Hananiah son of Shelemiah and Hanun sixth son of Zalaph repaired another section. After him Meshullam son of Berechiah made repairs opposite his living quarters.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him Malchijah, one of the goldsmiths, made repairs as far as the house of the temple servants and of the merchants, opposite the Muster Gate, and to the upper room of the corner.
speaker: Narrator

text: And between the upper room of the corner and the Sheep Gate the goldsmiths and the merchants made repairs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Sanballat heard that we were building the wall, he was angry and greatly enraged, and he mocked the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said in the presence of his associates and of the army of Samaria, “What are these feeble Jews doing? Will they restore it by themselves? Will they offer sacrifice? Will they finish it in a day? Will they revive the stones out of the heaps of rubbish—burned ones at that?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Tobiah the Ammonite was beside him, and he said, “That stone wall they are building—any fox going up on it would break it down!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O our God, for we are despised; turn their taunt back on their own heads, and give them over as plunder in a land of captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not cover their guilt, and do not let their sin be blotted out from your sight, for they have raged against the builders.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we rebuilt the wall, and all the wall was joined together to half its height, for the people had a mind to work.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Sanballat and Tobiah and the Arabs and the Ammonites and the Ashdodites heard that the repairing of the walls of Jerusalem was going forward and the gaps were beginning to be closed, they were very angry
speaker: Narrator

text: and all plotted together to come and fight against Jerusalem and to cause confusion in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we prayed to our God and set a guard as a protection against them day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Judah said, “The strength of the burden bearers is failing, and there is too much rubbish so that we are unable to work on the wall.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And our enemies said, “They will not know or see anything before we come upon them and kill them and stop the work.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Jews who lived near them came, they said to us ten times, “From all the places where they live they will come up against us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So in the lowest parts of the space behind the wall, in open places, I stationed the people according to their families, with their swords, their spears, and their bows.
speaker: Narrator

text: After I looked these things over, I stood up and said to the nobles and the officials and the rest of the people, “Do not be afraid of them. Remember the Lord, who is great and awesome, and fight for your kin, your sons, your daughters, your wives, and your households.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When our enemies heard that their plot was known to us and that God had frustrated it, we all returned to the wall, each to his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: From that day on, half of my servants worked on construction, and half held the spears, shields, bows, and body-armor, and the leaders posted themselves behind the whole house of Judah
speaker: Narrator

text: who were building the wall. The burden bearers carried their loads in such a way that each labored on the work with one hand and with the other held a weapon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And each of the builders had his sword strapped at his side while he built. The man who sounded the trumpet was beside me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said to the nobles, the officials, and the rest of the people, “The work is great and widely spread out, and we are separated far from one another on the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rally to us wherever you hear the sound of the trumpet. Our God will fight for us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So we labored at the work, and half of them held the spears from break of dawn until the stars came out.
speaker: Narrator

text: I also said to the people at that time, “Let every man and his servant pass the night inside Jerusalem, so that they may be a guard for us by night and may labor by day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So neither I nor my brothers nor my servants nor the men of the guard who followed me ever took off our clothes; each kept his weapon in his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a great outcry of the people and of their wives against their Jewish kin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there were those who said, “With our sons and our daughters, we are many; we must get grain, so that we may eat and stay alive.”
speaker: Narrator

text: There were also those who said, “We are having to pledge our fields, our vineyards, and our houses in order to get grain during the famine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were those who said, “We are having to borrow money on our fields and vineyards to pay the king’s tax.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now our flesh is the same as that of our kindred; our children are the same as their children; and yet we are forcing our sons and daughters to be slaves, and some of our daughters have been ravished; we are powerless, and our fields and vineyards now belong to others.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I was very angry when I heard their outcry and these complaints.
speaker: Narrator

text: After thinking it over, I contended with the nobles and the officials; I said to them, “You are all taking interest from your own people.” And I called a great assembly to deal with them
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to them, “As far as we were able, we have bought back our Jewish kindred who had been sold to other nations, but now you are selling your own kin, who must then be bought back by us!” They were silent and could not find a word to say.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I said, “The thing that you are doing is not good. Should you not walk in the fear of our God, to prevent the taunts of the nations our enemies?
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover I and my brothers and my servants are lending them money and grain. Let us stop this taking of interest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Restore to them, this very day, their fields, their vineyards, their olive orchards, and their houses, and the interest on money, grain, wine, and oil that you have been exacting from them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said, “We will restore everything and demand nothing more from them. We will do as you say.” And I called the priests and made them take an oath to do as they had promised.
speaker: Narrator

text: I also shook out the fold of my garment and said, “So may God shake out everyone from house and from property who does not perform this promise. Thus may they be shaken out and emptied.” And all the assembly said, “Amen,” and praised the Lord. And the people did as they had promised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, from the time that I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year to the thirty-second year of King Artaxerxes, twelve years, neither I nor my brothers ate the food allowance of the governor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The former governors who were before me laid heavy burdens on the people and took food and wine from them, besides forty shekels of silver. Even their servants lorded it over the people. But I did not do so because of the fear of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, I devoted myself to the work on this wall and acquired no land, and all my servants were gathered there for the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, there were at my table one hundred fifty people, Jews and officials, besides those who came to us from the nations around us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now that which was prepared for one day was one ox and six choice sheep; also fowls were prepared for me, and every ten days skins of wine in abundance, yet with all this I did not demand the food allowance of the governor, because of the heavy burden of labor on the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember for my good, O my God, all that I have done for this people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when it was reported to Sanballat and Tobiah and to Geshem the Arab and to the rest of our enemies that I had built the wall and that there was no gap left in it (though up to that time I had not set up the doors in the gates),
speaker: Narrator

text: Sanballat and Geshem sent to me, saying, “Come and let us meet together in one of the villages in the plain of Ono.” But they intended to do me harm.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I sent messengers to them, saying, “I am doing a great work, and I cannot come down. Why should the work stop while I leave it to come down to you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They sent to me four times in this way, and I answered them in the same manner.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way Sanballat for the fifth time sent his servant to me with an open letter in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: In it was written, “It is reported among the nations—and Geshem also says it—that you and the Jews intend to rebel; that is why you are building the wall; and according to this report you wish to become their king.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have also set up prophets to proclaim in Jerusalem concerning you, ‘There is a king in Judah!’ And now it will be reported to the king according to these words. So come, therefore, and let us confer together.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I sent to him, saying, “No such things as you say have been done; you are inventing them out of your own mind,”
speaker: Narrator

text: for they all wanted to frighten us, thinking, “Their hands will drop from the work, and it will not be done.” But now, strengthen my hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: One day when I went into the house of Shemaiah son of Delaiah son of Mehetabel, who was confined to his house, he said, “Let us meet together in the house of God, within the temple, and let us close the doors of the temple, for they are coming to kill you; indeed, tonight they are coming to kill you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said, “Should a man like me run away? Would a man like me go into the temple to save his life? I will not go in!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I perceived and saw that God had not sent him at all, but he had pronounced the prophecy against me because Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was hired for this purpose, to intimidate me and make me sin by acting in this way, and so they could give me a bad name, in order to taunt me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Tobiah and Sanballat, O my God, according to these things that they did, and also Noadiah the prophetess and the rest of the prophets who wanted to make me afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the wall was finished on the twenty-fifth day of the month Elul, in fifty-two days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when all our enemies heard of it, all the nations around us were afraid and fell greatly in their own esteem, for they perceived that this work had been accomplished with the help of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters to Tobiah, and Tobiah’s letters came to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many in Judah were bound by oath to him, because he was the son-in-law of Shecaniah son of Arah, and his son Jehohanan had married the daughter of Meshullam son of Berechiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also they spoke of his good deeds in my presence and reported my words to him. And Tobiah sent letters to intimidate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the wall had been built and I had set up the doors and the gatekeepers, the singers, and the Levites had been appointed,
speaker: Narrator

text: I gave my brother Hanani charge over Jerusalem, along with Hananiah the commander of the citadel, for he was a faithful man and feared God more than many.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said to them, “The gates of Jerusalem are not to be opened while the sun is hot; while the gatekeepers are still standing guard, let them shut and bar the doors. Appoint guards from among the inhabitants of Jerusalem, some at their watch posts, and others before their own houses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The city was wide and large, but the people within it were few, and no houses had been built.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then my God put it into my mind to assemble the nobles and the officials and the people to be enrolled by genealogy. And I found the book of the genealogy of those who were the first to come back, and I found the following written in it:
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the people of the province who came up out of the captivity of those exiles whom King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon had carried into exile; they returned to Jerusalem and Judah, each to his town.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nehum, Baanah.
The number of the Israelite people:
speaker: Narrator

text: the descendants of Parosh, two thousand one hundred seventy-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Shephatiah, three hundred seventy-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Arah, six hundred fifty-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Pahath-moab, namely, the descendants of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred eighteen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Elam, one thousand two hundred fifty-four.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Zattu, eight hundred forty-five.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Zaccai, seven hundred sixty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Binnui, six hundred forty-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Bebai, six hundred twenty-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Azgad, two thousand three hundred twenty-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Adonikam, six hundred sixty-seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Bigvai, two thousand sixty-seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Adin, six hundred fifty-five.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Ater, namely, of Hezekiah, ninety-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Hashum, three hundred twenty-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Bezai, three hundred twenty-four.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Hariph, one hundred twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Gibeon, ninety-five.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Bethlehem and Netophah, one hundred eighty-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Anathoth, one hundred twenty-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Beth-azmaveth, forty-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Kiriath-jearim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred forty-three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Ramah and Geba, six hundred twenty-one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Michmas, one hundred twenty-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Bethel and Ai, one hundred twenty-three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the other Nebo, fifty-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of the other Elam, one thousand two hundred fifty-four.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Harim, three hundred twenty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Jericho, three hundred forty-five.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred twenty-one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Senaah, three thousand nine hundred thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests: the descendants of Jedaiah, namely, the house of Jeshua, nine hundred seventy-three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Immer, one thousand fifty-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Pashhur, one thousand two hundred forty-seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Harim, one thousand seventeen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites: the descendants of Jeshua, namely, of Kadmiel of the descendants of Hodevah, seventy-four.
speaker: Narrator

text: The singers: the descendants of Asaph, one hundred forty-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gatekeepers: the descendants of Shallum, of Ater, of Talmon, of Akkub, of Hatita, of Shobai, one hundred thirty-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: The temple servants: the descendants of Ziha, of Hasupha, of Tabbaoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Keros, of Sia, of Padon,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Lebana, of Hagaba, of Shalmai,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Hanan, of Giddel, of Gahar,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Reaiah, of Rezin, of Nekoda,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Gazzam, of Uzza, of Paseah,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Besai, of Meunim, of Nephushesim,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Bakbuk, of Hakupha, of Harhur,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Bazlith, of Mehida, of Harsha,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Barkos, of Sisera, of Temah,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Neziah, of Hatipha.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Solomon’s servants: of Sotai, of Sophereth, of Perida,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Jaala, of Darkon, of Giddel,
speaker: Narrator

text: of Shephatiah, of Hattil, of Pochereth-hazzebaim, of Amon.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the temple servants and the descendants of Solomon’s servants were three hundred ninety-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: The following were those who came up from Tel-melah, Tel-harsha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer, but they could not prove their ancestral houses or their descent, whether they belonged to Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: the descendants of Delaiah, of Tobiah, of Nekoda, six hundred forty-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, of the priests: the descendants of Hobaiah, of Hakkoz, of Barzillai (who had married one of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite and was called by their name).
speaker: Narrator

text: These sought their registration among those enrolled in the genealogies, but it was not found there, so they were excluded from the priesthood as unclean;
speaker: Narrator

text: the governor told them that they were not to partake of the most holy food until a priest with Urim and Thummim should come.
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole assembly together was forty-two thousand three hundred sixty,
speaker: Narrator

text: besides their male and female slaves, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred thirty-seven, and they had two hundred forty-five singers, male and female.
speaker: Narrator

text: They had seven hundred thirty-six horses, two hundred forty-five mules,
speaker: Narrator

text: four hundred thirty-five camels, and six thousand seven hundred twenty donkeys.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now some of the heads of ancestral houses contributed to the work. The governor gave to the treasury one thousand darics of gold, fifty basins, and five hundred thirty priestly robes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of the heads of ancestral houses gave into the building fund twenty thousand darics of gold and two thousand two hundred minas of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what the rest of the people gave was twenty thousand darics of gold, two thousand minas of silver, and sixty-seven priestly robes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the priests, the Levites, the gatekeepers, the singers, some of the people, the temple servants, and all Israel settled in their towns.
When the seventh month came, the Israelites being settled in their towns,
speaker: Narrator

text: all the people gathered together into the square before the Water Gate. They told Ezra the scribe to bring the book of the law of Moses, which the Lord had given to Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Accordingly, Ezra the priest brought the law before the assembly, both men and women and all who could hear with understanding. This was on the first day of the seventh month.
speaker: Narrator

text: He read from it facing the square before the Water Gate from early morning until midday, in the presence of the men and the women and those who could understand, and the ears of all the people were attentive to the book of the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ezra the scribe stood on a wooden platform that had been made for the purpose, and beside him stood Mattithiah, Shema, Anaiah, Uriah, Hilkiah, and Maaseiah on his right hand and Pedaiah, Mishael, Malchijah, Hashum, Hash-baddanah, Zechariah, and Meshullam on his left hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ezra opened the book in the sight of all the people, for he was standing above all the people, and when he opened it, all the people stood up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Ezra blessed the Lord, the great God, and all the people answered, “Amen, Amen,” lifting up their hands. Then they bowed their heads and worshiped the Lord with their faces to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Levites Jeshua, Bani, Sherebiah, Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodiah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, Pelaiah helped the people to understand the law, while the people remained in their places.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they read from the book, from the law of God, with interpretation. They gave the sense, so that the people understood the reading.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Nehemiah, who was the governor, and Ezra the priest and scribe, and the Levites who taught the people said to all the people, “This day is holy to the Lord your God; do not mourn or weep.” For all the people wept when they heard the words of the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them, “Go your way, eat the fat and drink sweet wine and send portions of them to those for whom nothing is prepared, for this day is holy to our Lord, and do not be grieved, for the joy of the Lord is your strength.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Levites stilled all the people, saying, “Be quiet, for this day is holy; do not be grieved.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people went their way to eat and drink and to send portions and to make great rejoicing, because they had understood the words that were declared to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the second day the heads of ancestral houses of all the people, with the priests and the Levites, came together to Ezra the scribe in order to study the words of the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they found it written in the law that the Lord had commanded by Moses that the Israelites should live in booths during the festival of the seventh month
speaker: Narrator

text: and that they should publish and proclaim in all their towns and in Jerusalem as follows, “Go out to the hills and bring branches of olive, wild olive, myrtle, palm, and other leafy trees to make booths, as it is written.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people went out and brought them and made booths for themselves, each on the roofs of their houses, and in their courts and in the courts of the house of God, and in the square at the Water Gate and in the square at the Gate of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the assembly of those who had returned from the captivity made booths and lived in them, for from the days of Jeshua son of Nun to that day the Israelites had not done so. And there was very great rejoicing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And day by day, from the first day to the last day, Ezra read from the book of the law of God. They kept the festival seven days, and on the eighth day there was a solemn assembly, according to the ordinance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the twenty-fourth day of this month the Israelites were assembled with fasting and in sackcloth and with earth on their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then those of Israelite descent separated themselves from all foreigners and stood and confessed their sins and the iniquities of their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stood up in their place and read from the book of the law of the Lord their God for a fourth part of the day, and for another fourth they made confession and worshiped the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jeshua, Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani stood on the stairs of the Levites and cried out with a loud voice to the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Levites Jeshua, Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabneiah, Sherebiah, Hodiah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah said, “Stand up and bless the Lord your God from everlasting to everlasting. Blessed be your glorious name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ezra said, “You are the Lord, you alone; you have made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their host, the earth and all that is on it, the seas and all that is in them. To all of them you give life, and the host of heaven worships you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are the Lord, the God who chose Abram and brought him out of Ur of the Chaldeans and gave him the name Abraham;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you found his heart faithful before you and made with him a covenant to give to his descendants the land of the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Amorite, the Perizzite, the Jebusite, and the Girgashite, and you have fulfilled your promise, for you are righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you saw the distress of our ancestors in Egypt and heard their cry at the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: You performed signs and wonders against Pharaoh and all his servants and all the people of his land, for you knew that they acted insolently against our ancestors. You made a name for yourself that remains to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you divided the sea before them, so that they passed through the sea on dry land, but you threw their pursuers into the depths like a stone into mighty waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, you led them by day with a pillar of cloud and by night with a pillar of fire, to give them light on the way in which they should go.
speaker: Narrator

text: You came down also upon Mount Sinai and spoke with them from heaven and gave them right ordinances and true laws, good statutes and commandments,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you made known your holy Sabbath to them and gave them commandments and statutes and a law through Moses your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their hunger you gave them bread from heaven, and for their thirst you brought water for them out of the rock, and you told them to go in to possess the land that you swore to give them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But they, our ancestors, acted presumptuously and stiffened their necks and did not obey your commandments;
speaker: Narrator

text: they refused to obey and were not mindful of the wonders that you performed among them, but they stiffened their necks and appointed a leader to return to their slavery in Egypt. But you are a God ready to forgive, gracious and merciful, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love, and you did not forsake them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even when they had cast an image of a calf for themselves and said, ‘This is your God who brought you up out of Egypt,’ and had committed great blasphemies,
speaker: Narrator

text: you in your great mercies did not forsake them in the wilderness; the pillar of cloud that led them in the way did not leave them by day nor the pillar of fire by night that gave them light on the way by which they should go.
speaker: Narrator

text: You gave your good spirit to instruct them and did not withhold your manna from their mouths and gave them water for their thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forty years you sustained them in the wilderness so that they lacked nothing; their clothes did not wear out, and their feet did not swell.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you gave them kingdoms and peoples and allotted to them every corner, so they took possession of the land of King Sihon of Heshbon and the land of King Og of Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: You multiplied their descendants like the stars of heaven and brought them into the land that you had told their ancestors to enter and possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the descendants went in and possessed the land, and you subdued before them the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, and gave them into their hands, with their kings and the peoples of the land, to do with them as they pleased.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they captured fortress cities and a rich land and took possession of houses filled with all sorts of goods, hewn cisterns, vineyards, olive orchards, and fruit trees in abundance; so they ate and were filled and became fat and delighted themselves in your great goodness.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Nevertheless, they were disobedient and rebelled against you and cast your law behind their backs and killed your prophets, who had warned them in order to turn them back to you, and they committed great blasphemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore you gave them into the hands of their enemies, who made them suffer. Then in the time of their suffering they cried out to you, and you heard them from heaven, and according to your great mercies you gave them saviors who saved them from the hands of their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: But after they had rest, they again did evil before you, and you abandoned them to the hands of their enemies, so that they had dominion over them, yet when they turned and cried to you, you heard from heaven, and many times you rescued them according to your mercies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you warned them in order to turn them back to your law, yet they acted presumptuously and did not obey your commandments but sinned against your ordinances, by the observance of which a person shall live. They turned a stubborn shoulder and stiffened their neck and would not obey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many years you were patient with them and warned them by your spirit through your prophets, yet they would not listen. Therefore you handed them over to the peoples of the lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, in your great mercies you did not make an end of them or forsake them, for you are a gracious and merciful God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now therefore, our God—the great and mighty and awesome God, keeping covenant and steadfast love—do not treat lightly all the hardship that has come upon us, upon our kings, our officials, our priests, our prophets, our ancestors, and all your people, since the time of the kings of Assyria until today.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have been just in all that has come upon us, for you have dealt faithfully and we have acted wickedly;
speaker: Narrator

text: our kings, our officials, our priests, and our ancestors have not kept your law or heeded the commandments and the warnings that you gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even in their own kingdom, and in the great goodness you bestowed on them, and in the large and rich land that you set before them, they did not serve you and did not turn from their wicked works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here we are, slaves to this day, slaves in the land that you gave to our ancestors to enjoy its fruit and its good gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its rich yield goes to the kings whom you have set over us because of our sins; they have power also over our bodies and over our livestock at their pleasure, and we are in great distress.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of all this we make a firm agreement in writing, and on that sealed document are inscribed the names of our officials, our Levites, and our priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon the sealed document are the names of Nehemiah the governor, son of Hacaliah, and Zedekiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: Seraiah, Azariah, Jeremiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Pashhur, Amariah, Malchijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hattush, Shebaniah, Malluch,
speaker: Narrator

text: Harim, Meremoth, Obadiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Daniel, Ginnethon, Baruch,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshullam, Abijah, Mijamin,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah; these are the priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Levites: Jeshua son of Azaniah, Binnui of the sons of Henadad, Kadmiel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their associates Shebaniah, Hodiah, Kelita, Pelaiah, Hanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mica, Rehob, Hashabiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zaccur, Sherebiah, Shebaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hodiah, Bani, Beninu.
speaker: Narrator

text: The leaders of the people: Parosh, Pahath-moab, Elam, Zattu, Bani,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bunni, Azgad, Bebai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adonijah, Bigvai, Adin,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ater, Hezekiah, Azzur,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hodiah, Hashum, Bezai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hariph, Anathoth, Nebai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Magpiash, Meshullam, Hezir,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshezabel, Zadok, Jaddua,
speaker: Narrator

text: Pelatiah, Hanan, Anaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hoshea, Hananiah, Hasshub,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hallohesh, Pilha, Shobek,
speaker: Narrator

text: Rehum, Hashabnah, Maaseiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahiah, Hanan, Anan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Malluch, Harim, and Baanah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of the people, the priests, the Levites, the gatekeepers, the singers, the temple servants, and all who have separated themselves from the peoples of the lands to adhere to the law of God, their wives, their sons, their daughters, all who have knowledge and understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text: join with their kin, their nobles, and enter into a curse and an oath to walk in God’s law, which was given by Moses the servant of God, and to observe and do all the commandments of the Lord our Lord and his ordinances and his statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not give our daughters to the peoples of the land or take their daughters for our sons,
speaker: Narrator

text: and if the peoples of the land bring in merchandise or any grain on the Sabbath day to sell, we will not buy it from them on the Sabbath or on a holy day, and we will forego the crops of the seventh year and the exaction of every debt.
speaker: Narrator

text: We also lay on ourselves the obligation to charge ourselves yearly one-third of a shekel for the service of the house of our God:
speaker: Narrator

text: for the rows of bread, the regular grain offering, the regular burnt offering, the Sabbaths, the new moons, the appointed festivals, the sacred donations, and the sin offerings to make atonement for Israel, and for all the work of the house of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have also cast lots among the priests, the Levites, and the people for the wood offering, to bring it into the house of our God, by ancestral houses, at appointed times, year by year, to burn on the altar of the Lord our God, as it is written in the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: We obligate ourselves to bring the first fruits of our soil and the first fruits of all fruit of every tree, year by year, to the house of the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: also to bring to the house of our God, to the priests who minister in the house of our God, the firstborn of our sons and of our livestock, as it is written in the law, and the firstlings of our herds and of our flocks;
speaker: Narrator

text: and to bring the first of our dough, and our contributions, the fruit of every tree, the wine and the oil, to the priests, to the chambers of the house of our God; and to bring to the Levites the tithes from our soil, for it is the Levites who collect the tithes in all our rural towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priest, the descendant of Aaron, shall be with the Levites when the Levites receive the tithes, and the Levites shall bring up a tithe of the tithes to the house of our God, to the chambers of the storehouse.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Israelites and the sons of Levi shall bring the contribution of grain, wine, and oil to the storerooms where the vessels of the sanctuary are and where the priests who minister and the gatekeepers and the singers are. We will not neglect the house of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the leaders of the people lived in Jerusalem, and the rest of the people cast lots to bring one out of ten to live in the holy city Jerusalem, while nine-tenths remained in the other towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people blessed all those who willingly offered to live in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the leaders of the province who lived in Jerusalem, but in the towns of Judah all lived on their property in their towns: Israel, the priests, the Levites, the temple servants, and the descendants of Solomon’s servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in Jerusalem lived some of the Judahites and the Benjaminites. Of the Judahites: Athaiah son of Uzziah son of Zechariah son of Amariah son of Shephatiah son of Mahalalel, of the descendants of Perez;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Maaseiah son of Baruch son of Col-hozeh son of Hazaiah son of Adaiah son of Joiarib son of Zechariah son of the Shelahnite.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the descendants of Perez who lived in Jerusalem were four hundred sixty-eight valiant warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the Benjaminites: Sallu son of Meshullam son of Joed son of Pedaiah son of Kolaiah son of Maaseiah son of Ithiel son of Jeshaiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his brothers Gabbai, Sallai: nine hundred twenty-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel son of Zichri was their overseer, and Judah son of Hassenuah was second in charge of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the priests: Jedaiah son of Joiarib, Jachin,
speaker: Narrator

text: Seraiah son of Hilkiah son of Meshullam son of Zadok son of Meraioth son of Ahitub, officer of the house of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their associates who did the work of the house, eight hundred twenty-two; and Adaiah son of Jeroham son of Pelaliah son of Amzi son of Zechariah son of Pashhur son of Malchijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his associates, heads of ancestral houses, two hundred forty-two; and Amashsai son of Azarel son of Ahzai son of Meshillemoth son of Immer,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their associates, valiant warriors, one hundred twenty-eight; their overseer was Zabdiel son of Haggedolim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the Levites: Shemaiah son of Hasshub son of Azrikam son of Hashabiah son of Bunni;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Shabbethai and Jozabad, of the leaders of the Levites, who were over the outside work of the house of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mattaniah son of Mica son of Zabdi son of Asaph, who was the leader to begin the thanksgiving in prayer, and Bakbukiah, the second among his associates; and Abda son of Shammua son of Galal son of Jeduthun.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Levites in the holy city were two hundred eighty-four.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gatekeepers Akkub, Talmon, and their associates, who kept watch at the gates, were one hundred seventy-two.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest of Israel, and of the priests and the Levites, were in all the towns of Judah, all of them in their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the temple servants lived on Ophel, and Ziha and Gishpa were over the temple servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: The overseer of the Levites in Jerusalem was Uzzi son of Bani son of Hashabiah son of Mattaniah son of Mica, of the descendants of Asaph, the singers, in charge of the work of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there was a command from the king concerning them and a settled provision for the singers, as was required every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pethahiah son of Meshezabel, of the descendants of Zerah son of Judah, was at the king’s hand in all matters concerning the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for the villages, with their fields, some of the people of Judah lived in Kiriath-arba and its villages, and in Dibon and its villages, and in Jekabzeel and its villages,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in Jeshua and in Moladah and Beth-pelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: in Hazar-shual, in Beer-sheba and its villages,
speaker: Narrator

text: in Ziklag, in Meconah and its villages,
speaker: Narrator

text: in En-rimmon, in Zorah, in Jarmuth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zanoah, Adullam, and their villages, Lachish and its fields, and Azekah and its villages. So they camped from Beer-sheba to the valley of Hinnom.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Benjamin also lived from Geba onward, at Michmash, Aija, Bethel and its villages,
speaker: Narrator

text: Anathoth, Nob, Ananiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hazor, Ramah, Gittaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadid, Zeboim, Neballat,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lod, and Ono, the valley of artisans.
speaker: Narrator

text: And certain divisions of the Levites in Judah were joined to Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the priests and the Levites who came up with Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua: Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amariah, Malluch, Hattush,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shecaniah, Rehum, Meremoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Iddo, Ginnethoi, Abijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mijamin, Maadiah, Bilgah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shemaiah, Joiarib, Jedaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, Jedaiah. These were the leaders of the priests and of their associates in the days of Jeshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Levites: Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, and Mattaniah, who with his associates was in charge of the songs of thanksgiving.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bakbukiah and Unno their associates stood opposite them in the service.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeshua was the father of Joiakim, Joiakim the father of Eliashib, Eliashib the father of Joiada,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joiada the father of Jonathan, and Jonathan the father of Jaddua.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the days of Joiakim the priests, the heads of the ancestral houses, were: of Seraiah, Meraiah; of Jeremiah, Hananiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Ezra, Meshullam; of Amariah, Jehohanan;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Malluchi, Jonathan; of Shebaniah, Joseph;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Harim, Adna; of Meraioth, Helkai;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Iddo, Zechariah; of Ginnethon, Meshullam;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Abijah, Zichri; of Miniamin, of Moadiah, Piltai;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Bilgah, Shammua; of Shemaiah, Jehonathan;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Joiarib, Mattenai; of Jedaiah, Uzzi;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Sallai, Kallai; of Amok, Eber;
speaker: Narrator

text: of Hilkiah, Hashabiah; of Jedaiah, Nethanel.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the Levites, in the days of Eliashib, Joiada, Johanan, and Jaddua, there were recorded the heads of ancestral houses, also the priests until the reign of Darius the Persian.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites, heads of ancestral houses, were recorded in the Book of the Annals until the days of Johanan son of Eliashib.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the leaders of the Levites: Hashabiah, Sherebiah, and Jeshua son of Kadmiel, with their associates over against them, to praise and to give thanks, according to the commandment of David the man of God, section opposite to section.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mattaniah, Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, and Akkub were gatekeepers standing guard at the storehouses of the gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were in the days of Joiakim son of Jeshua son of Jozadak and in the days of Nehemiah the governor and of Ezra the priest and scribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem they sought out the Levites in all their places, to bring them to Jerusalem to celebrate the dedication with rejoicing, with thanksgivings and with singing, with cymbals, harps, and lyres.
speaker: Narrator

text: The companies of the singers gathered together from the circuit around Jerusalem and from the villages of the Netophathites,
speaker: Narrator

text: also from Beth-gilgal and from the region of Geba and Azmaveth, for the singers had built for themselves villages around Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priests and the Levites purified themselves, and they purified the people and the gates and the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I brought the leaders of Judah up onto the wall and appointed two great companies that gave thanks and went in procession. One went to the right on the wall to the Dung Gate,
speaker: Narrator

text: and after them went Hoshaiah and half the officials of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah, Ezra, Meshullam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah, Benjamin, Shemaiah, and Jeremiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and some of the young priests with trumpets: Zechariah son of Jonathan son of Shemaiah son of Mattaniah son of Micaiah son of Zaccur son of Asaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his kindred, Shemaiah, Azarel, Milalai, Gilalai, Maai, Nethanel, Judah, and Hanani, with the musical instruments of David the man of God, and Ezra the scribe went in front of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the Fountain Gate, in front of them, they went straight up by the stairs of the city of David, at the ascent of the wall, above the house of David, to the Water Gate on the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: The other company of those who gave thanks went to the left, and I followed them with half of the people on the wall, above the Tower of the Ovens, to the Broad Wall,
speaker: Narrator

text: and above the Gate of Ephraim, and by the Old Gate, and by the Fish Gate and the Tower of Hananel and the Tower of the Hundred, to the Sheep Gate, and they came to a halt at the Gate of the Guard.
speaker: Narrator

text: So both companies of those who gave thanks stood in the house of God, and I and half of the officials with me;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the priests Eliakim, Maaseiah, Miniamin, Micaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah, and Hananiah, with trumpets;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Maaseiah, Shemaiah, Eleazar, Uzzi, Jehohanan, Malchijah, Elam, and Ezer. And the singers sang with Jezrahiah as their leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: They offered great sacrifices that day and rejoiced, for God had made them rejoice with great joy; the women and children also rejoiced. The joy of Jerusalem was heard far away.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day men were appointed over the chambers for the stores, the contributions, the first fruits, and the tithes, to gather into them the portions required by the law for the priests and for the Levites from the fields belonging to the towns, for Judah rejoiced over the priests and the Levites who ministered.
speaker: Narrator

text: They performed the service of their God and the service of purification, as did the singers and the gatekeepers, according to the command of David and his son Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the days of David and Asaph long ago there was a leader of the singers, and there were songs of praise and thanksgiving to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the days of Zerubbabel and in the days of Nehemiah all Israel gave the daily portions for the singers and the gatekeepers. They set apart that which was for the Levites, and the Levites set apart that which was for the descendants of Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day they read from the book of Moses in the hearing of the people, and in it was found written that no Ammonite or Moabite should ever enter the assembly of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: because they did not meet the Israelites with bread and water but hired Balaam against them to curse them—yet our God turned the curse into a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people heard the law, they separated from Israel all those of foreign descent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now before this, Eliashib the priest, who was appointed over the chambers of the house of our God and who was related to Tobiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: prepared for Tobiah a large room where they had previously put the grain offering, the frankincense, the vessels, and the tithes of grain, wine, and oil, which were given by commandment to the Levites, singers, and gatekeepers, and the contributions for the priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: While this was taking place I was not in Jerusalem, for in the thirty-second year of King Artaxerxes of Babylon I went to the king. After some time I asked leave of the king
speaker: Narrator

text: and returned to Jerusalem. I then discovered the wrong that Eliashib had done on behalf of Tobiah, preparing a room for him in the courts of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I was very angry, and I threw all the household furniture of Tobiah out of the room.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I gave orders, and they cleansed the chambers, and I brought back the vessels of the house of God, with the grain offering and the frankincense.
speaker: Narrator

text: I also found out that the portions of the Levites had not been given to them, so that the Levites and the singers who had conducted the service had gone back to their fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I contended with the officials and said, “Why is the house of God forsaken?” And I gathered them together and set them in their stations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all Judah brought the tithe of the grain, wine, and oil into the storehouses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I appointed as treasurers over the treasuries Shelemiah the priest, Zadok the scribe, and Pedaiah of the Levites, and as their assistant Hanan son of Zaccur son of Mattaniah, for they were considered faithful, and their duty was to distribute to their associates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember me, O my God, concerning this, and do not wipe out my good deeds that I have done for the house of my God and for his service.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days I saw in Judah people treading winepresses on the Sabbath and bringing in heaps of grain and loading them on donkeys, and also wine, grapes, figs, and all kinds of burdens that they brought into Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, and I warned them at that time against selling food.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tyrians also, who lived in the city, brought in fish and all kinds of merchandise and sold them on the Sabbath to the people of Judah in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I contended with the nobles of Judah and said to them, “What is this evil thing that you are doing, profaning the Sabbath day?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did not your ancestors act in this way, and did not our God bring all this disaster on us and on this city? Yet you bring more wrath on Israel by profaning the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When it began to be dark at the gates of Jerusalem before the Sabbath, I commanded that the doors should be shut and gave orders that they should not be opened until after the Sabbath. And I set some of my servants over the gates, to prevent any burden from being brought in on the Sabbath day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the merchants and sellers of all kinds of merchandise spent the night outside Jerusalem once or twice.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I warned them and said to them, “Why do you spend the night in front of the wall? If you do so again, I will lay hands on you.” From that time on they did not come on the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I commanded the Levites that they should purify themselves and come and guard the gates, to keep the Sabbath day holy. Remember this also in my favor, O my God, and spare me according to the greatness of your steadfast love.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days also I saw Jews who had married women of Ashdod, Ammon, and Moab,
speaker: Narrator

text: and half of their children spoke the language of Ashdod, and they could not speak the language of Judah but spoke the language of various peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I contended with them and cursed them and beat some of the men and pulled out their hair, and I made them take an oath in the name of God, saying, “You shall not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons or for yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did not King Solomon of Israel sin on account of such women? Among the many nations there was no king like him, and he was beloved by his God, and God made him king over all Israel; nevertheless, foreign women made even him to sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall we then listen to you and do all this great evil and act treacherously against our God by marrying foreign women?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of the sons of Jehoiada, son of the high priest Eliashib, was the son-in-law of Sanballat the Horonite; I chased him away from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember them, O my God, because they have defiled the priesthood, the covenant of the priests and the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus I cleansed them from everything foreign, and I established the duties of the priests and Levites, each in his work,
speaker: Narrator

text: and I provided for the wood offering, at appointed times, and for the first fruits. Remember me, O my God, for good.
speaker: Narrator
